title: Ecobee Smart Thermostat Premium ‚Äî Set It and Forget It
summary: A thermostat with room sensors, built-in air quality monitoring, and smart scheduling that learns your routine.
editorsNote: Reddit's r/ecobee is full of posts about the C-wire requirement causing installation headaches ‚Äî the included Power Extender Kit works but adds complexity. Users also note the built-in Alexa speaker is mediocre quality. Most agree the room sensors alone justify the premium over Nest.
content:
How to stop heating empty rooms and arguing over the thermostat

Here's a scenario most households know: the thermostat is in the hallway, but you spend your day in the home office upstairs. The hallway reads 72¬∞F, so the system shuts off ‚Äî meanwhile your office is 78¬∞F because heat rises and the sun bakes that side of the house. Or worse, you and your partner fight over the temperature because the bedroom is always too warm when the living room is comfortable. Traditional thermostats only measure temperature in one spot, which means your HVAC system is optimizing for a hallway nobody sits in.

The Ecobee Smart Thermostat Premium solves this with wireless room sensors. Place them in the rooms you actually use ‚Äî bedroom, office, living room ‚Äî and the thermostat adjusts based on occupancy and temperature where it matters. When you're working in your office, it prioritizes that sensor. When you move to the living room at night, it shifts focus. This alone fixes the single biggest problem with central HVAC. Compared to the Nest Learning Thermostat, which only learns from one location, the multi-sensor approach is fundamentally better at maintaining comfort.

Two standout features simplify daily life beyond basic temperature control. The built-in air quality monitor tracks VOCs, CO2, and humidity, alerting you when it's time to open a window or run ventilation ‚Äî useful during wildfire season or winter when homes are sealed tight. Geofencing uses your phone's location to automatically switch to Away mode when everyone leaves, and pre-conditions the house before you return. Combined with Home Assistant, the Ecobee becomes part of a fully automated home that adjusts itself without your input.

The concrete savings are well-documented: Ecobee claims 26% average savings on heating and cooling, and independent studies from Energy Star confirm 20-23% reductions. On a $200/month HVAC bill, that's $40-50 saved monthly ‚Äî the thermostat ($250) pays for itself in 5-6 months. Beyond money, you reclaim the mental energy spent manually adjusting the thermostat, remembering to turn it down when you leave, and mediating temperature disputes. The scheduled energy reports show exactly where your money goes and suggest specific optimizations.

‚ö° Set it up in 5 minutes

  1. Turn off power to your HVAC system at the breaker before any wiring
  2. Remove your old thermostat and connect the Ecobee using the labeled wire guide (use the Power Extender Kit if you don't have a C-wire)
  3. Download the Ecobee app and follow the on-screen setup to connect to Wi-Fi and configure your schedule
  4. Place room sensors in the rooms you use most ‚Äî they're battery-powered and stick to walls with included mounts
  5. Enable geofencing and let the thermostat learn your patterns for 1-2 weeks
frictionNote: Installation requires basic wiring knowledge or a professional install (~$75). Needs a C-wire or the included power extender kit.
